Hmmm.... try edge or chrome?  I'm using FF and W10 too....

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Gargamel said:
> 
> 
> Hmmm.... try edge or chrome?  I'm using FF and W10 too....
> 

Well Edge works as expected (i.e. pasting a link to an image results in the image being displayed), but I'd rather not switch browser just for this. All a bit wierd especially with this being a new install.

At least I know it's not anything to do with the forum... just wonky FF beahaviour for some reason.
[@purpleivan](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120081-purpleivan/) Have you tried “paste as plain text?” Sometimes this seems to make a difference.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, CatastrophicFailure said:
> 
> 
> [@purpleivan](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120081-purpleivan/) Have you tried “paste as plain text?” Sometimes this seems to make a difference.
> 

If I do that (Ctrl Shift V) then I get the same result plus an error "The link could not be embedded because of an unexpected error: error: undefined."

Until just now I've just been using Ctrl-V to paste, but I've found out that pasting works correctly if I select Paste from the right click menu instead. Not a proper solution really as Ctrl-V should work fine.

This is clearly an issue with my setup though, not an issue with the forum, so I'll keep looking for a solution.

Update... the issues seems to be related to addons I have install in Firefox. If I disable all of them the Ctrl V behaviour is back to normal, as well as a completly different issue I've been looking into. The ones I have are the same as in my old Win 7 install (installed using Sync in Firefox) but one of them must be not playing nicely in the new OS.

At least I have something to look into now.

Updated update... found out what it was, it was Internet Download Manager. It was set to use Ctrl as a hotkey to force downloading of things clicked on with IDM. That's the same setup as I had in Win 7, which worked fine, but for some reason in the Win 10 install it breaks my use of Ctrl V in this specific way. Disables the feature now (didn't use it anyway) and the problem is now fixed.

![58kcKFf.png](https://i.imgur.com/58kcKFf.png)

When I paste a pic into a post it displays as a link until I hit the submit button and then the image replaces the text. I have noticed no recent changes to this. Win7/Chrome.
Are the forums acting odd? I get a waving dot suggesting they are not loading the pages up completely.

Anyone else having issues with twitter links in the forum today?

Why do all mods have a profile picture?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Nigel J. Cardozo said:
> 
> 
> Why do all mods have a profile picture?
> 

Not a mod but I can answer that one. They're awesome.

I leave it up to the reader to decide if I mean the pictures, or the mods. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

But seriously most people who stay on a forum for more than a few months tend to customize their profile a bit. Most of those who have been on a forum more than a year have fully done do. Moderators tend to fall into the latter category, and those that don't fall in the former.
